intro: Carpoxis prinoides, commonly known as the yellow buttercup, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many showy, often toxic plants. The plant features bright yellow flowers with five petals and is typically found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are palmately divided, giving it a distinctive, fern-like appearance. The species is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to thrive in disturbed soils.
